meanings.definition: Resembling or having the form of a leaf.
meanings.sent1: The phylloid shape of the ornament made it look like a tiny leaf.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted phylloid patterns on the canvas to mimic nature.
meanings.sent3: The phylloid design on the dress made it seem like the model was walking in a garden.
meanings.sent4: The phylloid shadows cast by the trees created a beautiful pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The phylloid structure of the building's roof blended seamlessly with the surrounding trees.

meanings.definition: A plant or structure that resembles a leaf.
meanings.sent1: The garden had a variety of phylloids, from ferns to ivy.
meanings.sent2: The phylloid in the corner of the room added a touch of nature to the decor.
meanings.sent3: The phylloid in the park was so realistic that birds often tried to perch on it.
meanings.sent4: The phylloid sculpture in the garden seemed to sway in the wind like a real leaf.
meanings.sent5: The phylloid plant in the office brightened up the space with its greenery.
